modelComponent.longName: GISS ModelE version 2, Cubed-sphere, HYCOM ocean

modelComponent.description: Depending on physics_version this code may or may not be used. physics_version=1 It is NOT used (aerosol mass is read in instead from offline, decadally varying fields) physics_version=2 It is used. AIE is parameterised physics_version=3 It is used. AIE is calculated prognostically

componentProperty.value: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NASA Goddard Institute for Space Studies USA

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Bauer, S.E., D. Koch, N. Unger, S.M. Metzger, D.T. Shindell, and D.G. Streets, 2007: Nitrate aerosols today and in 2030: Importance relative to other aerosol species and tropospheric ozone. Atmos. Chem. Phys., 7, 5043-5059, doi:10.5194/acp-7-5043-2007.

Menon, S., D. Koch, G. Beig, S. Sahu, J. Fasullo and D. Orlikowski 2010: Black carbon aerosols and the third polar ice cap, Atmos. Chem. Phys., 10, 4559-4571.

modelComponent.longName: GISS model for Physical Understanding of Composition-Climate INteractions and Impacts (G-PUCCINI)
modelComponent.description: Depending on physics_version this code may or may not be used. physics_version=1 It is NOT used (radiatively important gases are read in instead from offline, decadally varying fields) physics_version=2, 3 It is used.

modelComponent.description: CH4 , N2O and CFCs are prescribed at the lower boundary. CH4 is only set in this fashion for historical runs, not future scenarios

componentProperty.value: CO, NOx,paraffin, aldehydes, alkenes, ammonia, SO2, CH4
CO biomass burning, NOx aircraft + biomass burn, Alkenes biomass burn, Paraffin biomass burn
